Articles.Content: No mods installed. Is this completely new?
Trees? Nope, they've been around for quite a while now.

Trees? Nope, they've been around for quite a while now.

Damnit...

The trees? That's called Terrain scatter, you can set it's density in the settings menu.

It isn't trees-only, it also creates rocks on the Mun, those strange thingies on Pol, etc.

The trees? That's called Terrain scatter

Yeah, I had that turned off up until about a week ago for some reason.
I saw trees to the Northwest of the Space Center in 0.20. They aren't new.
I think they've had trees since at least 0.14 judging by Danny's videos; someone who has played earlier versions can update on those.

I think they've had trees since at least 0.14 judging by Danny's videos; someone who has played earlier versions can update on those.

There've been trees since before .13, at least. I joined in .13 (or possibly earlier) and they were an option. It's a little-known option, I guess.
yea, its the groundscatter option, you turn it on you gets trees, but its not on by default

Maybe they should put the default state on this option on "Endabled"

It is something I often forget to switch on, when I install a new update

No wonder many people (who donÃ‚Â´t even know about this option) are surprised by trees and stones
No reason to be embarrassed, man. The Kerbin system is big. Nobody has seen all of it. All of us are seeing new things all the time.
